•16.  Description:  THIS IS A SYNOPSIS NOTICE ONLY.  This is not a solicitation or request for quote or proposal and no contract or purchase order will be awarded from this notice.  USNS BURLINGTON (T-EPF 10) is tentatively scheduled for a Post Shakedown Availability and Dry Docking (PSA/DD) ship repair availability beginning October 7, 2019, with a performance period of 75 days.  The USNS BURLINGTON (T-EPF 10) has a length of 338 Ft, A Beam of 93.5 Ft, and is 2,460 tons.  The purpose of this notice is to inform all potential offerors that Military Sealift Command (MSC) will be releasing a RFP on/or about May 19, 2019.

SUBJECT: Z--Replace water system Piping & Appurtenances, LEWI
CONTACT: Fuller, Phaedra
DESC:
This is a Pre-Solicitation Notice announcing that the National Park Service, Lewis & Clark National Historical Park, intends to issue a Request for Proposals for construction, for a contractor to replace the water mains and appurtenances at the Fort Clatsop Visitor Center, as well as cap and abandon existing pipes. Total lineal feet is approx. 3,100. Visitor center will remain open during construction. This project is being solicited and awarded as a total (100%) Small Business set-aside. The NAICS code for this solicitation is 237110, Water and Sewer Line and Related Structures Construction, with an associated small business size standard of $36.5 million. The magnitude of construction for this project is between $250,000 and $500,000. This magnitude range is required in accordance with FAR 36.204 and is not the government's estimate. A single firm-fixed price construction contract will be awarded as a result of the solicitation. Solicitation number 140P8319R0009 will be issued as a Request for Proposals, posted to FedBizOpps "FBO" at http://www.fbo.gov between April 30th and May 10th, 2019, with a response date 30 days thereafter.

PROJECT LOCATION. The project is located at the Fort Clatsop Visitor Center within Lewis & Clark National Historical Site, 92345 Fort Clatsop Road, Astoria, Oregon 97102. The visitor center is located at Fort Clatsop Road approximately 2 miles south of Warrenton, Oregon. Driving directions are available at the following website address:  https://www.nps.gov/lewi/planyourvisit/directions.htm.

PRE-PROPOSAL SITE VISIT. An organized pre-proposal site is scheduled for all interested parties on Thursday, May 16, 2019 at 1pm (PST). This site visit information is also provided in Section L of Solicitation Attachment no. 3, Terms-Conditions. Interested parties shall RSVP directly to Colby Mackley, Chief of Facility Management, at Lewis & Clark NHP. RSVP by phone at (360) 461-1198 or by email to Colby_Mackley@nps.gov. If RSVP by email, please also cc: Phaedra_Fuller@nps.gov. Attendees shall meet at the Fort Clatsop Visitor Center (front of building by main entry) at 1pm. Colby Mackley will provide a site walk and talk about the project, note and answer any questions. However, if answers cannot be provided during the site visit, then Colby will note those questions, and they will be answered in the site visit notes that will be posted as a separate attachment to the solicitation, as an amendment to the solicitation within 3 days of the site visit. If questions arise immediately after the site visit, please send them in writing by email to Colby, and cc: Phaedra Fuller, Contracting Officer (email Phaedra_Fuller@nps.gov). It is strongly encouraged that anyone interested in potentially submitting a proposal for this project, attend the site visit. In no event shall failure to inspect the site constitute grounds for a claim after contract award. 

PROJECT PERIOD OF PERFROMANCE. The government anticipates awarding the contract in June 2019, and plans to have on-site construction work begin in September 2019, as coordinated with the project team. Anticipated period of performance is 60 calendar days from issuance of the Notice to Proceed. Offeror should plan to get through all project submittals after award, by end of July 2019, and complete all on-site construction work between August and September 2019.

PAPER COPIES OF THE SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED and telephone requests, email requests, or fax requests for the solicitation will not be accepted.  The solicitation package will be posted between April 30th and May 10th, 2019. The full solicitation package, including the Standard Form 1442 (solicitation form SF-1442) and all associated attachments, will be available in FedBizOpps. This Pre-Solicitation Notice announcement does not constitute the solicitation. 

ALL QUESTIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED BY EMAIL, IN WRITING (NO PHONE OR FAX QUESTIONS). Submit questions in writing, sending by email to Phaedra_Fuller@nps.gov, and cc: Colby_Mackley@nps.gov. Please reference the solicitation number in the subject line of the email, as "140P8319R0009/QUESTION." Interested parties are urged to check FedBizOpps for amendments.

NOTE 1: Reminder that the solicitation will be posted to FBO between April 30th and May 10th, 2019. The Contracting Officer will be out of the office April 15th - May 6th. Once the solicitation is posted, Colby Mackley, Chief of Facility Management, Lewis & Clark National Historical Park, will be able to answer some if not all questions asked about the solicitation, while Phaedra is out of the office. If Colby cannot immediately provide an answer, he will compile the questions and upon Phaedra's return to the office, she will amend the solicitation on/about May 7th, to post the compiled Q&A as a separate attachment. 

NOTE 2: This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available, a contract will be awarded at that time. (Funds are expected to become available in June 2019, however, Offerors shall guarantee their proposal for 90 calendar days from the solicitation closing date).

The Government reserves the right to cancel this solicitation.

SUBJECT: Cryogenics Plant Construction
CONTACT: Frank G. Minton, Procurement Manager, Phone 6308405485, Email fminton@fnal.gov
DESC:
Fermi Research Alliance LLC a prime contractor for the Department of Energy has a requirement to construct a cryogenics plant building.  We are performing market research to locate sources to construct the cryogenics plant building.

The purpose of the cryogenics plant building is to house cryogenic plant equipment to be used to cool the superconducting cryogenic modules for the PIP-II accelerator.

An approximate 23,000 SF building will be constructed to house cryogenic equipment including compressors, cold boxes, storage tanks, vaporizers, nitrogen separator, purification equipment/skids, transfer lines, overhead cranes, control systems, and support equipment.  


Subcontractor (NAICS 236220 Commercial and Institutional Building Construction) shall provide all labor, materials, bonding, safety, quality, transportation, and supervision to mobilize and construct the PIP-II Cryogenics Plant Building on the Fermilab site.

Market research is being performed to learned if small or Native American owned businesses are  available and capable to perform as prime Subcontractor to construct the Cryogenics Plant building.   Based on the market research the requirement may be set-aside for small business or Native American Businesses.

The scope of this acquisition is to construct the cryogenics plant building to house cryogenic plant equipment.

This acquisition will be for the building and infrastructure only.  The cryogenic equipment will be obtained from an international donor.  Installation of the cryogenic equipment will be accomplished as a separate procurement. It is requested potential sources fill out the attached form:   Sources Sought Questions.
201904.

FRA's current schedule looks as follows:

Activity Planned Completion Date
Issue RFP (FBO) 4QFY19
Evaluate and Negotiate 1QFY20
DOE Approval of Subcontract Award 1QFY20
Award Subcontract  2QFY20
Kickoff Meeting 2QFY20
Delivery Complete 3QFY21

SUBJECT: Motivair Chiller Systems Training Course and Material Procurement
CONTACT: Hyun K. Choi, Contract Specialist, Phone 3157559304, Email hyun.k.choi.civ@mail.mil - Stephen M. Pastore, Contracting Officer, Phone 3157828190, Email stephen.m.pastore.civ@mail.mil
DESC: The contractor shall provide an onsite operations, maintenance and troubleshooting course for the Motivair Free Cooling Chiller Systems installed at the Flight Simulator Mission Training Facility (B-771) located on Kunsan Air Base, Republic of Korea. Training will be provided to HVAC shop personnel by a technician proficient with Motivair systems and with a Motivair certification. This training must not interfere with simulator training operations in any way unless absolutely necessary. Ideally, the course shall span a length of 10 duty days and will have a minimum of 10 HVAC technicians in attendance. Training and troubleshooting, shall include the following but will not be limited to all items listed in section 3.0. The contractor shall provide the attendees with a certificate of training after course completion. The contractor shall also procure all required materials to replace in-operable parts as stated in Attachment 1 for both chiller systems. Additionally, the government will provide daily transportation from the hotel to the training site and process/receive any materials the contractor shipped for training and repair.
POPADDRESS:
Kunsan AB in South Korea
Gunsan

"AMC-Level Protest Program If you have complaints about this procurement, it is preferable that you first attempt to resolve those concerns with the responsible contracting officer. However, you can also protest to Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 20 working days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. All other agency-level protests should be sent to the contracting officer for resolution. Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 Packages sent by FedEx or UPS should be addressed to: Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 The AMC-Level Protest procedures are found at: http://www.amc.army.mil/pa/COMMANDCOUNSEL.asp. If internet access is not available, contact the contracting officer or HQ, AMC to obtain the HQ AMC-Level Protest Procedures."

(b) Representations. The offeror represents that it [ ] does [ ] does not reside or primarily do business in the set-aside area. (c) An offeror is considered to be residing or primarily doing business in the set-aside area if, during the last twelve months (1) The offeror had its main operating office in the area; and (2) That office generated at least half of the offeror's gross revenues and employed at least half of the offeror's permanent employees. (d) If the offeror does not meet the criteria in paragraph (c) of this provision, factors to be considered in determining whether an offeror resides or primarily does business in the set-aside area include (1) Physical location(s) of the offeror's permanent office(s) and date any office in the set-aside area(s) was established; (2) Current state licenses; (3) Record of past work in the set-aside area(s) (e.g., how much and for how long); (4) Contractual history the offeror has had with subcontractors and/or suppliers in the set-aside area; (5) Percentage of the offeror's gross revenues attributable to work performed in the set-aside area; (6) Number of permanent employees the offeror employs in the set-aside area; (7) Membership in local and state organizations in the set-aside area; and (8) Other evidence that establishes the offeror resides or primarily does business in the set-aside area. For example, sole proprietorships may submit utility bills and bank statements. (e) If the offeror represents it resides or primarily does business in the set-aside area, the offeror shall furnish documentation to support its representation if requested by the Contracting Officer. The solicitation may require the offeror to submit with its offer documentation to support the representation.
